recordings.loc: Crosby Township (near  Harrison), Hamilton County, Ohio
recordings.rmk: Up to seven birds loosely associating in oak-hickory forest. This bird responded to playback of querr calls and drumming with its own subsequent drumming directly above my head, about 20 ft (~ 6 m).

recordings.loc: Mayo, Lafayette County, Florida
recordings.rmk: Tapping  after chasing episode, heard amidst much querr calling and drumming by multiple individuals.  This was early season as pairs were reinforcing pair bonds and preparing cavities.

recordings.loc: Mayo, Lafayette County, Florida
recordings.rmk:
Chatter call issued by adult as it perched near the nest cavity while holding food in its bill.  Presumably the adults were attempting to entice the nestling(s) to the entrance and ultimately to fledge.
2 seconds silence inserted at beginning and end of clip.

recordings.loc: Mayo, Lafayette County, Florida
recordings.rmk:
One second silence inserted at beginning and end of recording.  

Birds were "querr" calling. drumming, and displaying territorial aggression with much chasing and vocalizing, all in vicinity of a nest cavity in area with many nesting pairs.

recordings.loc: Mayo, Lafayette County, Florida
recordings.rmk:
Multiple birds drumming and issuing "querr" calls. Early stages of pair formation with much drumming and calling, one pair seen performing "peek-a-boo" behavior and some chasing.  At least six active nest cavities confirmed on this small tract in 2020 and 2021 and it appears there will be that many or more in 2022.

Two seconds silence inserted at beginning and end.  Very slight noise reduction applied in Audacity.

Four Mile Draw Rd, Custer State Park, South Dakota
recordings.rmk:
Agonistic calls from a red-headed woodpecker as it was being chased away from a tree trunk by a Lewis's Woodpecker. I think all of these calls are from the red-headed woodpecker, but I can't be sure whether some aren't from the Lewis's.

This area appears to have suffered a fire in recent years since all the trees in this area were dead trunks. As a result, this area held a large number of woodpeckers, including hairy, lewis's, red-headed, and northern flicker.

recordings.loc: Four Mile Draw Rd, Custer State Park, South Dakota
recordings.rmk:
Calls and drumming, likely from a different bird than XC254600. This bird was in a dead tree on the other side of the gravel road, high up on a hillside.

This area appears to have suffered a fire in recent years since all the trees in this area were dead trunks. As a result, this area held a large number of woodpeckers, including hairy, lewis's, red-headed, and northern flicker.

recordings.loc: Four Mile Draw Rd, Custer State Park, South Dakota
recordings.rmk:
Interaction calls from a pair of red-headed woodpeckers. This recording includes the individual from XC254600. After that recording another bird flew into the tree and there was some commotion. Eventually both birds flew off.

This area appears to have suffered a fire in recent years since all the trees in this area were dead trunks. As a result, this area held a large number of woodpeckers, including hairy, lewis's, red-headed, and northern flicker.

A bird drumming and calling from a branch of dead ponderosa pine on a grassy hill next to a gravel road. Drumming occurs at 0:50 and 1:25.

This area appears to have suffered a fire in recent years since all the trees in this area were dead trunks. As a result, this area held a large number of woodpeckers, including hairy, lewis's, red-headed, and northern flicker.

recordings.loc: Oxford, Lafayette County, Mississippi
recordings.rmk:
Foraging about 2/3 of the way up a large red oak on the interior branches and trunk. All three birds chattering and chasing one another. Distance from microphone ~20m.

#Habitat#
State waterfowl refuge along the margins of USACE flood control reservoir. Strip along the lake margins ~1km wide of moist soil grassland with mix of forbs, native warm season grasses (Andropogon, Schyzachyrium, Eragrostis, Aristida, etc.), and some sparse woody vegetation (Cephalanthus, Quercus saplings, etc.) bounded by oak hickory forest and, in places, pine plantation.  Three or four shallow waterfowl impoundments partially flooded in the winter.

#Editing#
Edited in Adobe Audition. Butterworth high-pass filter, order 3, cutoff frequency 700 Hz. 

#Equipment#
Fostex FR-2 digital recorder with Sennheiser microphone and Telinga pro 22" parabolic reflector.
